bomberman.core.ui
Interface UIScreen

All Superinterfaces:
playn.core.Keyboard.Listener, playn.core.Pointer.Listener
All Known Implementing Classes:
GameScreen, LoadScreen, LoseScreen, PauseScreen, StartScreen, WinScreen
public interface UIScreen
extends playn.core.Pointer.Listener, playn.core.Keyboard.Listener

An interface for supporting the basic functionalities needed for each of the game's components (such as the Load Screens, Pause Screens, and Game Levels) that need to both receive information about how much time has elapsed and receive callbacks to paint their state on the screen.

This interface wraps both Keyboard.Listener and Pointer.Listener, whose methods are called when a particular UIScreen is active.

Method Summary
 void drawSurface(playn.core.Surface surface)
          Called by PlayN, provides the immediate layer renderer accelerated GPU drawing.
 void hide()
          Hides the current UIScreen.

          Loads the current UIScreen's assets.
 void paint(float alpha)
          When called by PlayN, notifies the active UIScreen to paint its associated elements.
 void show()
          Shows the current UIScreen.
 void update(int delta)
          When called by PlayN, notifies the active UIScreen that the provided amount of time has passed in the game
